intro: Jurinella squarrosa, commonly known as the roughleaf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its yellow, daisy-like flowers and hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. Jurinella squarrosa is often found in desert and semi-desert environments, demonstrating adaptability to arid conditions.
